tit.cmt: Kashinokidai と大文字にしました。

sen.j: 荒河かしの木台駅（あらがかしのきだいえき）は、京都府福知山市にある、北近畿タンゴ鉄道(KTR)北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Araga-kashinokidai Station is a train station on the Miyafuku Line of Kitakinki-tango Railway Corporation (KTR) in Fukuchiyama City Kyoto.
Araga-kashinokidai Station is a train station on the Miyafuku Line of the Kitakinki-tango Railway Corporation (KTR) in Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto.
Araga-Kashinokidai Station, located in Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railroad facility on the Miyafuku Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).
Station structure
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のプラットホームを持つ無人駅である。
sen.e: An unmanned station with two lines and two opposing platforms.
It is an unmanned station with two lines and two opposing platforms.
It is an unmanned station with two opposing platforms and two tracks running in between.

sen.j: 駅舎は無く、階段で高架上のホームへ上ることになる。
sen.e: There is no station office and stairs lead up to the elevated platform.
There is no station office, and a stairway leads to the elevated platform.
There is no station building, and the elevated platform is reached by means of a stairway.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: ホーム上に待合室がある。
sen.e: There is a waiting room on the platform.
There is a waiting room on the platform.
There is a waiting room on the platform.

sen.j: 駅の南に宮福線の車庫（福知山運転支区）があり、ここまでの列車もある（2007年3月改正時点では設定なし）。
sen.e: To the south of the station is a train depot (Fukuchiyama operation area) and some trains terminate here. (no setup at time of revision in March 2007).
South of the station is a train depot (Fukuchiyama operation area) at which certain trains terminate (no setup at time of revision in March 2007).
South of the station is a train depot (Fukuchiyama operation area) at which certain trains terminate (no setup at time of revision in March 2007).

sen.j: 福知山駅からこの駅までJR山陰本線が並行するが山陰本線に駅はない。
sen.e: The JR Sanin main line runs parallel from Fukuchiyama station past this station however there is no stop here on the Sanin Main line.
The JR Sanin main line runs parallel from Fukuchiyama Station past this facility, but there is no stop here on the Sanin Main line.
The JR Sanin Main Line runs parallel from Fukuchiyama Station past this facility, but there is no stop here on the Sanin Main line.
sen.cmt: Main Line と大文字にしました。

sen.e: Vicinity of the station
The station's surroundings
Station surroundings
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 駅の西に新興住宅地である「かしの木台」がある。
sen.e: To the west of the station is new residential area called Kashinokidai.
A new residential area called Kashinokidai is located west of the station.
A new residential area called Kashinokidai is located west of the station.
Utilization
Passenger usage statistics
Passenger use
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約27人である。
sen.e: The average number of passengers boarding at this station per day in 2006 was 27.
The average daily number of passengers boarding at this station in 2006 was 27.
The average daily number of passengers boarding at this station in fiscal year 2006 was 27.
sen.cmt: fiscal year を追加しました。

sen.e: (from Kyoto Prefectural statistics)
(According to Kyoto prefectural statistics)
(According to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report)
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 付近に新興住宅地があるが、駅の利用者は極めて少ない。
sen.e: The new residential area is near the station however the number of people using the station is extremely low.
Despite the existence of a new residential area near the station, very few people use this facility.
Despite the existence of a new residential area near the station, very few people use this facility.
history
History
History

sen.j: 1988年7月16日、宮福鉄道（現・北近畿タンゴ鉄道）宮福線の駅として開業。
sen.e: The station opened on July 16, 1988, as a station on the Miyafuku line of Miyafuku Railways (now Kitakinki tango Railways).
The station opened on July 16, 1988, as a station on the Miyafuku Line of Miyafuku Railways (now Kitakinki Tango Railways).
July 16, 1988: The station opened as a station on the Miyafuku Line of Miyafuku Railway (now Kitakinki Tango Railways).
sen.cmt: 日付、コロン の表現に統一しました。

sen.e: Atsunakatonya station, Araga-kashinokidai station, Maki station
